image.altText: a woman with brown hair in a lab coat

props.synopsis: Tasmanian TAFE graduates worry as some locally taught courses that helped them forge a career may disappear as the cost to study them increases dramatically.

title.children: From $4,000 to $21,000 — lab training in Tasmania could be a thing of the past

image.altText: Brooke St Pier wind damage  2025-10-06 11:10:00

props.synopsis: Wind gusts of about 90 kilometres per hour were measured in Hobart on Sunday afternoon, with the blustery conditions set to continue this week.

title.children: Heavy winds dislodge Brooke Street Pier on Hobart waterfront

image.altText: a police officer in uniform

props.synopsis: The man has not been seen since he was searching for his car in dense bushland in northern Tasmania on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Search continues for Tasmanian man, 76, lost in dense bush

image.altText: A fire truck drives through the Ashley Youth Detention Centre carpark.

props.synopsis: Police said they were called to the site on Sunday afternoon following reports of a disturbance involving three armed youths.

title.children: Three youths charged with arson following fire at Ashley detention centre

image.altText: a river seen from a helicopter

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman has drowned after the raft she was travelling in flipped on the fifth day of a planned 10-day pack-rafting adventure in the remote Franklin-Gordon Wild Rivers National Park.

title.children: Woman drowns on Franklin River rafting trip

image.altText: Six boxes showing names and photos of Tasmanian MLCs.

props.synopsis: The future of Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium rests in the hands of the state's politicians. So who will vote which way, and what is the chance it will actually get up?

title.children: The fate of the Hobart stadium rests with a handful of politicians. What do they think?

image.altText: A woman in a pantsuit sits on a chair next to a table of books.

props.synopsis: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

title.children: Jilly Cooper, English author known for her 'bonkbusters' dies at age 88

image.altText: A woman sits a court deck.

props.synopsis: Less than a year after the landmark trial which shook the world, Gisèle Pelicot will once again brave a courtroom as one of her rapists appeals his sentence.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot to face rapist once again in French appeals case

image.altText: A PowerPoint showing the three scientists with their faces, biography and a headshot

props.synopsis: The Nobel Prize for Medicine has been given to three scientists for discovering how our immune systems protect us from microbes.

title.children: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for work on immune system

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape says there is a "high possibility" the country would not enter a conflict involving Australia and China, despite having signed a mutual defence treaty with its southern neighbour.

title.children: Marape says PNG would stay neutral in any potential Australia-China conflict

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus customers have come forward to report more cases of triple-0 calls failing outside the embattled telcos previously admitted outages.

title.children: Optus customers left angry after more failed triple-0 calls

image.altText: Workers in high-vis use handheld drills to break through a large slab of concrete

props.synopsis: The number of people killed in the disaster could still rise, with some half a dozen children still unaccounted for.

title.children: At least 63 killed in Indonesian school collapse with others still missing

image.altText: Armed forces stand on a hazy city street

props.synopsis: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago streets in 1968. It changed the city forever.

title.children: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago in 1968 — it left the city 'traumatised'

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Victoria's Director of Public Prosecutions will appeal the sentence handed down to convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson.

title.children: Prosecutors to appeal 'manifestly inadequate' sentence for Erin Patterson

image.altText: Lawrence Wong, a Singaporean man smiles while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Singapore's Prime Minister, Lawrence Wong, offers his condolences to the families of four Australians who died during an Optus network technical failure last month, which impacted hundreds of triple-0 calls.

title.children: Singapore PM gives condolences to families impacted by Optus outage deaths

image.altText: An office building with at least seven floors. The building has multi-coloured cladding.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

title.children: Gambling regulator's alleged 'cosy relationship' with $50b betting industry

image.altText: weatherboard home off its stumps, with security fence around it

props.synopsis: The NSW Reconstruction Authority says the breach occurred in March and involved the personal data of applicants to the Northern Rivers Resilient Homes Program.

title.children: Major data breach as up to 3,000 flood victims' details loaded to ChatGPT

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

props.synopsis: A close family member of a tour guide who died in the Whakaari White Island eruption in 2019 has given an emotional statement as the inquest into the tragedy continues.

title.children: Frustrated families call for answers at Whakaari White Island inquest

image.altText: tony stands in house

props.synopsis: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidation this week.

title.children: Clients of Melbourne builder lose life savings as company goes bust

image.altText: Two women in a green outdoor setting looking at the camera. One is wearing a brown blouse and the other a floral top.

props.synopsis: A decades-old psychiatric study is influencing current debates over transgender youth health care. But a new analysis led by a survivor says the findings were deeply harmful and dangerously misleading.

title.children: 'Conversion therapy' survivor speaking out against trans health study

image.altText: Snow covered Mount Bogong

props.synopsis: Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

title.children: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger

image.altText: Man in suit points into the distance, stands in front of Australian flag

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is calling for the political temperature to be "turned down" after a Queensland man was charged for allegedly threatening to kill him.

title.children: Alleged death threat signals time to 'turn the temperature down', PM says

image.altText: A black and tan dachshund stands proudly in a lounge room

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: The psychology of bringing 'mad' Valerie in from the wild

image.altText: Lewis Moody looks to one side

props.synopsis: Lewis Moody, a former England rugby captain who helped his side win the 2003 World Cup, has been diagnosed with Motor Neurone Disease.

title.children: Rugby World Cup winner reveals MND diagnosis

image.altText: A hand reaches towards a chess piece on a board.

props.synopsis: World number two Hikaru Nakamura has beaten the current world champion Gukesh Dommaraju and thrown his king to the cheering crowd, prompting the chess world to debate whether it was showmanship or disrespect.

title.children: Chess world split over piece-throwing celebration

image.altText: A child's hands hold a wooden pencil and rest above a writing book

props.synopsis: Primary school homeschooling registrations in Queensland grew by 110 per cent from 2021 to 2025.

title.children: More Australian families are homeschooling. How can we make sure they do it well?

image.altText: GettyImages-2239364328

props.synopsis: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving at the Singapore Grand Prix "shouldn't be in F1", after Oscar Piastri openly criticised Norris's driving.

title.children: 'Shouldn't be in F1': Norris hits back at critics after Piastri incident

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: The body of Melbourne woman Isla Bell was so badly damaged that forensic experts were unable to say how she died, a court has been told.

title.children: Forensic pathologist unable to say how 19-year-old Isla Bell died

image.altText: A sinking ship.

props.synopsis: The New Zealand government says it has done "the right thing" in offering a $5.3 million compensation payout to the Samoan government after its navy sunk a ship on a pristine reef off the Pacific island.

title.children: NZ does 'the right thing' in $5.3m payout after sinking navy ship on Samoan reef

image.altText: A line of hikers wading through snow in poor visibility, dressed up in hiking gear, carrying climbing sticks.

props.synopsis: Local villagers and rescue teams help hikers stranded on Mount Everest after a snowstorm pummels the Himalayas.

title.children: Mount Everest rescue underway as blizzard traps hundreds of trekkers

image.altText: Kotoni Staggs and Ben Hunt hug as the Broncos celebrate winning the 2025 NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: Defeat in the 2015 decider was so scarring, Hunt eventually felt the need to move away from the club he loves. Ten years later and back in his home colours, he's a 350-game, premiership-winning NRL player.

title.children: 'We got it done for him': NRL's oldest player Ben Hunt finally tastes premiership victory

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: Mark Latham and Nathalie Matthews together at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested on Sunday morning after arriving on a flight from Dubai at Sydney Airport.

title.children: Mark Latham's ex-partner granted bail after sharing intimate image charges

image.altText: A man exposes his backside to Tadej Pogačar.

props.synopsis: A spectator pulled down his pants and bared his bottom towards two-time reigning world cycling champion Tadej Pogačar, while others slapped stickers on his back. But the Slovenian still won the European Championships road race.

title.children: 'This is weird': Bare-arsed spectator can't stop Pogačar
